üìä Calculation Details

Understanding how fees are distributed

üî¢ Opportunity Score Calculation

The foundation of fair distribution is the Opportunity Score, which measures each player's contribution relative to team performance.

Batting Opportunity

bat = (ballsFaced √ó battingPositionWeight) / totalTeamBattingContribution

  • Batting Position Weights:
  • Positions 1-2: 1.0x (openers get full weight)
  • Positions 3-4: 0.9x
  • Positions 5-6: 0.8x
  • Positions 7-8: 0.65x
  • Positions 9+: 0.5x (tailenders get reduced weight)

Bowling Opportunity

bowl = ballsBowled / totalTeamBallsBowled

Simple proportional contribution based on overs bowled.

Total Opportunity Score

opportunityScore = (bat √ó 0.5) + (bowl √ó 0.5)

Equal weighting of batting and bowling contributions.

üéØ Performance Bonuses

Individual excellence is rewarded with bonus percentage points:

Strike Rate >180: +2%
Strike Rate >150: +1%
Runs ‚â•30: +1%
Economy <6: +1%
Wickets ‚â•2: +1%
Wickets ‚â•3: +2%

Note: These bonuses are SUBTRACTED from the base percentage, meaning better players get LESS share (inverse relationship).

‚öñÔ∏è Final Distribution

  1. Calculate Base %: (opportunityScore / totalOpportunity) √ó 100
  2. Apply Bonuses: Subtract performance bonuses
  3. Clamp Range: Ensure each player gets 3-15%
  4. Normalize: Adjust to ensure total = 100%
  5. Calculate Amount: final% √ó totalAmount

üéØ Why This Approach?

  • Fair Opportunity: Rewards players who contribute more to team success
  • Individual Excellence: Penalizes exceptional performers to redistribute to the team
  • Balanced Range: Prevents any player from dominating the distribution
  • Team Focus: Encourages collective performance over individual heroics
